test_cases.name: create_user_assert_status_code
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for a POST endpoint to create a user
Use the UserService.createUser method with UserModel type
Assert that the status code is 201

test_cases.name: list_users
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for the GET /users endpoint that retrieves a paginated list of users
Call UserService.getUsers
Assert that the response status is 200

test_cases.name: get_user_by_id
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for the GET /users/{userId} endpoint that retrieves a single user
Call UserService.getUserById with a valid user id
Assert that the response status is 200

test_cases.name: update_user
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the update target
Test the main positive scenario for the PUT /users/{userId} endpoint that updates an existing user
Call UserService.updateUser with the created user's id and a payload typed as UpdateUserModel
Assert that the update response status is 200

test_cases.name: patch_user
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the patch target
Test the main positive scenario for the PATCH /users/{userId} endpoint that performs a partial update
Call UserService.patchUser with the created user's id and a payload typed as PatchUserModel that only changes a subset of fields
Assert that the patch response status is 200

test_cases.name: delete_user
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the delete target
Test the main positive scenario for the DELETE /users/{userId} endpoint that removes an existing user
Call UserService.deleteUser with the created user's id
Assert that the delete response status is 204

test_cases.name: get_user_by_id_with_precondition
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook
Test the main positive scenario for the GET /users/{userId} endpoint that retrieves a single user
Call UserService.getUserById with the id from the created user
Assert that the response status is 200

test_cases.name: delete_user_with_get_check
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the delete target
Test the main positive scenario for the DELETE /users/{userId} endpoint that removes an existing user
Call UserService.deleteUser with the created user's id
Assert that the delete response status is 204
After the delete, attempt to retrieve the deleted user using UserService.getUserById and assert that it results in a 404

test_cases.name: create_user_with_postcondition
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for a POST endpoint to create a user
Use the UserService.createUser method with UserModel type
Assert that the status code is 201
Assert that the response data contains the created user's id, name, and email using optional chaining (e.g., response.data?.id)
Delete the created user using UserService.deleteUser inside an after or afterEach hook

test_cases.name: create_user_verify_response_body
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for a POST endpoint to create a user
Use the UserService.createUser method with UserModel type
Assert that the status code is 201
Assert that the response contains a numeric id
Assert that the response name matches the request name
Assert that the response email matches the request email

test_cases.name: create_user_verify_with_get
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for a POST endpoint to create a user
Use the UserService.createUser method with UserModel type
Assert that the status code is 201
After creating the user, call UserService.getUserById with the created user's id
Assert that the GET response status is 200
Assert that the retrieved user's name matches the created user's name
Assert that the retrieved user's email matches the created user's email

test_cases.name: update_user_verify_response_body
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the update target
Test the main positive scenario for the PUT /users/{userId} endpoint that updates an existing user
Call UserService.updateUser with the created user's id and a payload typed as UpdateUserModel
Assert that the update response status is 200
Assert that the response contains the same user id as the created user
Assert that the response name matches the updated name
Assert that the response email matches the updated email

test_cases.name: update_user_verify_with_get
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the update target
Test the main positive scenario for the PUT /users/{userId} endpoint that updates an existing user
Call UserService.updateUser with the created user's id and a payload typed as UpdateUserModel
Assert that the update response status is 200
After updating the user, call UserService.getUserById with the user's id
Assert that the GET response status is 200
Assert that the retrieved user's name matches the updated name
Assert that the retrieved user's email matches the updated email

test_cases.name: patch_user_verify_partial_update
evaluation_criteria: Create a new user using UserService.createUser inside a before or beforeEach hook to serve as the patch target
Test the main positive scenario for the PATCH /users/{userId} endpoint that performs a partial update
Call UserService.patchUser with the created user's id and a payload typed as PatchUserModel that only changes the name field
Assert that the patch response status is 200
Assert that the response name matches the patched name
Assert that the response email remains unchanged from the original user (verifying partial update behavior)

test_cases.name: list_users_verify_response_structure
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for the GET /users endpoint that retrieves a list of users
Call UserService.getUsers
Assert that the response status is 200
Assert that the response contains a data property that is an array
Assert that the response contains a total property that is a number
If the data array is not empty, assert that users have id, name, and email properties

test_cases.name: create_user_with_random_data
evaluation_criteria: Test the main positive scenario for a POST endpoint to create a user
Generate random name and email values to create the user
Use the UserService.createUser method with UserModel type using the generated random values
Assert that the status code is 201
